definition: to return good for evil (idiom)/to requite evil with good
abbr. for Israel 以色列[Yi3 se4 lie4]
to use/by means of/according to/in order to/because of/at (a certain date or place)
Germany/German/abbr. for 德國|德国[De2 guo2]
virtue/goodness/morality/ethics/kindness/favor/character/kind
to announce/to inform/report/newspaper/recompense/revenge/CL:份[fen4],張|张[zhang1]
to blame/to complain

sentences.english: Bible says to requite evil with good.
He had to render an apology for his rudeness.
sentences.chinese: 他一直是個以德報怨的人。

sentences.english: He is the man who always renders good for evil.
sentences.chinese: 他一向是個以德報怨的人。

sentences.english: Forill do well, then fear not hell.
Good for good eery man can do, good for bad only a noble man can do.
sentences.chinese: 以德報怨只有高尚的人才能辦到。

sentences.english: He those rechangings good for evil obtains the victory.
sentences.chinese: 以德報怨的人得到勝利。

sentences.english: My father taught me to render good for evil.
sentences.chinese: 我父親教導我要以德報怨。

sentences.english: The sages of ancient times taught us to render good for evil.
sentences.chinese: 古代聖賢教導我們要以德報怨。

sentences.english: The bible says to requite evil with good.
